paragraph.heading:
Tetralonioidella longqiensis Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov.
( Figs 13–15 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The new species is very similar to
T . fukienensis
, but both sexes apical margin of labrum convex medially.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 13.
Tetralonioidella longqiensis Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
, male. a. Body, lateral view. b. Head, frontal view. c. Labrum, frontal view. d. Antenna. e. Mesosoma, dorsal view. f. Metasoma, dorsal view. Scale bars= 1 mm.

Figure 14.
Tetralonioidella longqiensis Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
, male. a. Fore wing, showing the papillae. b. Claw, showing the inner ramus. c. S7, ventral view. d. S8, ventral view. e. Genitalia, dorsal view. f. Genitalia, lateral view. Scale bars: a, e, f = 1 mm; b, c, d =0.5 mm.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined. Holotype . ♂ , China , Fujian , Mt. Longqi ( 26º44′N , 117º24′E ; elev.
850 m
),
26.VI.1991
, coll.

Xingjian Wang. Paratype . 1♀ , same locality as holotype,
25.VI.1991
, coll. Longlong Yang.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 15.
Tetralonioidella longqiensis Niu & Zhu
,
sp. nov.
, female. a. Body, lateral view. b. Head, frontal view. c. Labrum, frontal view. d. Antenna. e. Fore wing, showing the papillae. f. Mesosoma, dorsal view. g. Metasoma, dorsal view. h. Claw, showing the inner ramus. Scale bars: a, b, c, d, e, f, g = 1 mm; h =0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The type location Mt. Longqi ( Fujian , China ) is given as the specific name.
